concept.title: Limits for Inserting OLE Objects
concept.shortdesc: ZWCAD set some limits when linking or embedding the OLEobjects. All these inherent limits are used for designing OLE objects.

conbody.p: OLE objects are not displayed or plotted on xrefs or block references.
Modifications made for plotting rotation are not reflected on OLE objects when using Microsoft Windows systemplotter. Change plot orientation in Windows Plotting systemconfiguration dialog box.

ZWCAD limits the size of the spreadsheet that is imported as OLE object. If import too large a spreadsheet, you can reduce the column width and row height, and reduce the font size or partly paste the spreadsheet so as to divide the OLE objects into several objects in smaller size. Before importing OLE objects into other applications, use Windows copyclip viewer to preview OLE object.
